$description: System-level configuration tokens that control global UI behavior. These are framework-agnostic primitives that can be transformed to any framework's naming convention during build.

scale.$description: Global scale factor for UI components. 1 = default size, 0.8 = 80% size, 1.2 = 120% size. Affects computed dimensions when frameworks support proportional scaling.

cursor.$description: Cursor styles for different interaction states

interactive.$description: Cursor for clickable/interactive elements. Use 'pointer' for buttons, links, and actionable items.

default.$description: Standard cursor for non-interactive content. Use for text, containers, and static elements.

fontSmoothing.$description: Font rendering optimization settings for different browsers/platforms. Use for consistent text rendering across operating systems.

webkit.$description: WebKit font smoothing for macOS/iOS. Use for crisp, thin text in heading and body text. Apply to -webkit-font-smoothing CSS property.

moz.$description: Mozilla font smoothing for Firefox. Use for crisp text rendering in heading and body content. Apply to -moz-osx-font-smoothing CSS property.

heading.$description: Global heading (h1-h6) typography configuration tokens for consistent visual hierarchy

textWrap.$description: Text wrapping behavior for headings. 'wrap' allows natural line breaks, 'balance' distributes text more evenly.
